original_solution_mapping.L1: He has to cook 115 hamburgers and has already cooked 40 so he needs to cook 115-40 = <<115-40=75>>75 more hamburgers
original_solution_mapping.L2: He can only cook 15 hamburgers at a time so that means he has to cook 75/15 = <<75/15=5>>5 more cooking sessions

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 371.
    Returns: the number of additional sessions needed to cook all hamburgers.
    """
    # L1
    total_hamburgers_needed = 115 # 115 hamburgers in total
    hamburgers_already_cooked = 40 # already cooked 40 hamburgers
    hamburgers_remaining_to_cook = total_hamburgers_needed - hamburgers_already_cooked

    # L2
    hamburgers_per_session = 15 # 15 hamburgers per session
    sessions_needed = hamburgers_remaining_to_cook / hamburgers_per_session

    # FA
    answer = sessions_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has to cook {total_hamburgers_needed} hamburgers and has already cooked {hamburgers_already_cooked} so he needs to cook {total_hamburgers_needed}-{hamburgers_already_cooked} = <<{total_hamburgers_needed}-{hamburgers_already_cooked}={hamburgers_remaining_to_cook}>>{hamburgers_remaining_to_cook} more hamburgers

He can only cook {hamburgers_per_session} hamburgers at a time so that means he has to cook {hamburgers_remaining_to_cook}/{hamburgers_per_session} = <<{hamburgers_remaining_to_cook}/{hamburgers_per_session}={sessions_needed}>>{sessions_needed} more cooking sessions

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He has to cook 115 hamburgers and has already cooked 40 so he needs to cook 115-40 = <<115-40=75>>75 more hamburgers
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He can only cook 15 hamburgers at a time so that means he has to cook 15/15 = <<15/15=1>>1 more cooking sessions

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'hamburgers_per_session' (value: 15) was used instead of 'hamburgers_remaining_to_cook' (value: 75).
